Are balloons really still necessary?
Yes

Yes, they really are! It's how we get profiles of temperature and dewpoint vertically through the atmosphere. This information is very important to weather forecasting as it provides some of the information the computer models use to forecast the weather. The more launch sites we have, the better information is available which leads to better forecasts. In fact, all such sites around the world launch their balloons within a few minutes of each other, twice a day. The data is provided to the World Meteorological Organization and shared among many countries. If I recall correctly I believe there are 31 sites in Canada.
